==Events==
* [[28]] BCE &ndash; A [[sunspot]] is [[Science and technology of the Han Dynasty#Astronomical observations|observed]] by [[Han Dynasty]] [[Chinese astronomy|astronomers]] during the reign of [[Emperor Cheng of Han]], one of the earliest dated sunspot observations in China.
* [[70]] &ndash; [[Siege of Jerusalem (70)|Siege of Jerusalem]]: [[Titus]], son of emperor [[Vespasian]], opens a full-scale assault on [[Jerusalem]] and attacks the city's Third Wall to the northwest.
*[[1291]] &ndash; Scottish [[nobles]] recognize the authority of [[Edward I of England]].
*[[1497]] &ndash; [[Amerigo Vespucci (explorer)|Amerigo Vespucci]] allegedly leaves [[Cádiz]] for his first voyage to the [[New World]].
*[[1503]] &ndash; [[Christopher Columbus]] visits the [[Cayman Islands]] and names them ''Las Tortugas'' after the numerous [[turtle]]s there.
*[[1534]] &ndash; [[Jacques Cartier]] visits [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]].
*[[1655]] &ndash; England, with troops under the command of [[William Penn (admiral)|Admiral William Penn]] and [[Robert Venables|General Robert Venables]], annexes [[Jamaica]] from Spain.
*[[1768]] &ndash; [[John Wilkes]] is imprisoned for writing an article for ''[[The North Briton]]'' severely criticizing [[George III of the United Kingdom|King George III]]. This action provokes rioting in London.
*[[1773]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of Great Britain]] passes the [[Tea Act]], designed to save the [[British East India Company]] by granting it a [[monopoly]] on the North American [[tea]] trade.
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[Louis XVI of France|Louis XVI]] and [[Marie Antoinette]] become King and Queen of France.
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: A small Colonial militia led by [[Ethan Allen]] and Colonel [[Benedict Arnold]] [[Capture of Fort Ticonderoga|captures Fort Ticonderoga]].
*  1775   &ndash; American Revolutionary War: Representatives from the [[Thirteen Colonies]] begin the [[Second Continental Congress]] in [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|Philadelphia]].
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[First Coalition]]: [[Napoleon I of France]] wins a [[Battle of Lodi|decisive victory]] against [[Habsburg Empire|Austria]]n forces at [[Lodi, Lombardy|Lodi]] bridge over the [[Adda River]] in Italy. The Austrians lose some 2,000 men.
*[[1801]] &ndash; [[First Barbary War]]: The [[Barbary pirates]] of [[Tripoli]] declare war on the United States of America.
*[[1824]] &ndash; The [[National Gallery, London|National Gallery]] in London opens to the public.
*[[1833]] &ndash; The desecration of the grave of the viceroy of [[Northern and southern Vietnam|southern Vietnam]] [[Lê Văn Duyệt]] by Emperor [[Minh Mạng]] provokes his [[Lê Văn Khôi|adopted son]] to [[Lê Văn Khôi revolt|start a revolt]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Panic of 1837]]: New York City banks fail, and [[unemployment]] reaches record levels.
*[[1849]] &ndash; [[Astor Place Riot]]: A riot breaks out at the [[Astor Opera House]] in [[Manhattan]], New York City over a dispute between actors [[Edwin Forrest]] and [[William Charles Macready]], killing at least 25 and injuring over 120.
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Indian Rebellion of 1857]]: In India, the first war of Independence begins. [[Sepoy]]s mutiny against their commanding officers at [[Meerut]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[Stonewall Jackson|Thomas "Stonewall" Jackson]] dies eight days after he is accidentally [[Friendly fire|shot by his own troops]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War: Colonel [[Emory Upton]] leads a 10-[[regiment]] "Attack-in-depth" assault against the Confederate works at The [[Battle of Spotsylvania]], which, though ultimately unsuccessful, would provide the idea for the massive [[Benjamin T. Brockman#Battle of the Bloody Angle|assault against the Bloody Angle]] on [[May 12]]. Upton is slightly wounded but is immediately promoted to Brigadier general.
*[[1865]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Jefferson Davis]] is captured by [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops near [[Irwinville, Georgia]].
*  1865   &ndash; American Civil War: In [[Kentucky]], Union soldiers ambush and mortally wound Confederate [[Quantrill's Raiders|raider]] [[William Quantrill]], who lingers until his death on [[June 6]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Romania]] National Holiday 1866-1947, The Modern Monarchy Instauration of the [[Kingdom of Romania]], [[Carol I of Romania]]
*[[1869]] &ndash; The [[First Transcontinental Railroad]], linking the eastern and western United States, is completed at [[Promontory Summit]], [[Utah]] (not [[Promontory Point, Utah]]) with the [[golden spike]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Victoria Woodhull]] becomes the first woman nominated for [[President of the United States]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[Romania]] declares itself independent from the [[Ottoman Empire]] following the [[Senate of Romania|Senate]] adoption of [[Mihail Kogălniceanu]]'s Declaration of Independence. Recognized on March 26, 1881 after the end of the [[Romanian War of Independence]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules in ''[[Nix v. Hedden]]'' that a [[tomato]] is a [[vegetable]], not a [[fruit]], under the [[Tariff of 1883|Tariff Act of 1883]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; The [[Horch|Horch & Cir. Motorwagenwerke AG]] is founded.
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Mother's Day]] is observed for the first time in the United States, in [[Grafton, West Virginia]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; Sailing in the lifeboat [[Voyage of the James Caird|''James Caird'']], [[Ernest Shackleton]] arrives at [[South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands|South Georgia]] after a journey of 800 nautical miles from [[Elephant Island]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The United States annexes the [[Kingman Reef]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[J. Edgar Hoover]] is appointed first Director of the United States' [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] (FBI), and remains so until his death in [[1972]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Censorship]]: In Germany, the [[Nazism|Nazis]] stage [[Nazi book burnings|massive public book burnings]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: German fighters accidentally bomb the German city of [[Freiburg]].
*  1940 &ndash; World War II: [[Nazi Germany|German]] raids on British shipping convoys and military airfields begin.
*  1940 &ndash; World War II: Germany invades [[Battle of Belgium|Belgium]], the [[Battle of the Netherlands|Netherlands]] and [[German occupation of Luxembourg in World War II|Luxembourg]].
*  1940 &ndash; World War II: [[Winston Churchill]] is appointed [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] following the resignation of [[Neville Chamberlain]].
*  1940 &ndash; World War II: [[Invasion of Iceland]] by the United Kingdom.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]] in London is damaged by the [[Luftwaffe]] in an [[airstrike|air raid]].
*  1941 &ndash; World War II: [[Rudolf Hess]] parachutes into Scotland to try to negotiate a peace deal between the United Kingdom and [[Nazi Germany]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The Thai [[Phayap Army]] invades the [[Shan States]] during the [[Burma Campaign]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; First successful launch of an American [[V-2 rocket]] at [[White Sands Missile Range|White Sands Proving Ground]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Republic of China]] implements "[[Temporary Provisions Effective During the Period of Communist Rebellion|temporary provisions]]" granting [[President of the Republic of China|President]] [[Chiang Kai-shek]] extended powers to deal with the [[Chinese Civil War|Communist uprising]]; they will remain in effect until 1991.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Bill Haley & His Comets]] release "[[Rock Around the Clock]]", the first [[rock and roll]] record to reach number one on the [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] charts.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The nuclear submarine {{USS|Triton|SSRN-586|6}} completes [[Operation Sandblast]], the first underwater circumnavigation of the [[earth]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Marvel Comics]] publishes the first issue of [[Hulk (comics)|The Incredible Hulk]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The Battle of [[Dong Ap Bia]] begins with an assault on Hill 937. It will ultimately become known as [[Battle of Hamburger Hill|Hamburger Hill]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Bobby Orr]] scores "The Goal" to win the [[1970 Stanley Cup Finals]], for the [[Boston Bruins]]' fourth [[National Hockey League|NHL]] championship in their history.  
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Sony]] introduces the [[Betamax]] [[videocassette recorder]] in Japan.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Federated States of Micronesia]] become self-governing.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[François Mitterrand]] wins the presidential election and becomes the first [[Socialist Party (France)|Socialist]] [[President of France]] in the [[France|French Fifth Republic]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; In [[Thailand]], a fire at the [[Kader Toy Factory]] kills 156 workers.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Nelson Mandela]] is inaugurated as South Africa's first black [[President of South Africa|president]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; A 7.3 [[Moment magnitude scale|M<sub>w</sub>]] earthquake [[1997 Qayen earthquake|strikes]] [[Iran]]'s [[Khorasan (Province)|Khorasan Province]], killing 1,567, injuring over 2,300, leaving 50,000&nbsp;homeless, and damaging or destroying over 15,000&nbsp;homes.
*  1997   &ndash; The [[Maeslantkering]], a storm surge barrier in the Netherlands that is one of the world's largest moving structures, is opened by [[Beatrix of the Netherlands|Queen Beatrix]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; F.B.I. agent [[Robert Hanssen]] is sentenced to [[Life without parole|life imprisonment without the possibility of parole]] for selling United States secrets to Moscow for $1.4 million in cash and [[diamond]]s.
*[[2005]] &ndash; A [[hand grenade]] thrown by [[Vladimir Arutinian]] lands about 65 feet (20 meters) from U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] while he is giving a speech to a crowd in [[Tbilisi]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], but it malfunctions and does not detonate.
*[[2008]] &ndash; An [[Enhanced Fujita Scale|EF4]] tornado strikes the [[Oklahoma]]–[[Kansas]] state line, killing 21 people and injuring over 100.
*[[2012]] &ndash; The [[10 May 2012 Damascus bombings|Damascus bombings]] are carried out using a pair of [[car bombs]] detonated by [[suicide bombers]] outside of a military intelligence complex in [[Damascus]], [[Syria]], killing 55 people and injuring 400 others
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[One World Trade Center]] becomes the tallest building in the [[Western Hemisphere]].
